semantic_title: Psychoactive Substance Use, Unspecified - Documentation and Reporting Requirements
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 5. Chapter 5: Mental, Behavioral and Neurodevelopmental disorders > b. Mental and behavioral disorders due to psychoactive substance use > 3) Psychoactive Substance Use, Unspecified

content.full_text: As with all other unspecified diagnoses, the codes for unspecified psychoactive substance use (F10.9-, F11.9-, F12.9-, F13.9-, F14.9-, F15.9-, F16.9-, F18.9-, F19.9-) should only be assigned based on provider documentation and when they meet the definition of a reportable diagnosis (see Section III, Reporting Additional Diagnoses). These codes are to be used only when the psychoactive substance use is associated with a substance related disorder (chapter 5 disorders such as sexual dysfunction, sleep disorder, or a mental or behavioral disorder) or medical condition, and such a relationship is documented by the provider. (Evidence: pg no: 44, L52-L60)
content.summary: Establishes strict requirements for unspecified psychoactive substance use codes, requiring provider documentation, reportable diagnosis criteria, and documented relationship to substance-related disorders or medical conditions (Evidence: pg no: 44, L52-L60)
key_concepts: Provider documentation requirement (Evidence: pg no: 44, L55-L56)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign only based on provider documentation (Evidence: pg no: 44, L55-L56)
detailed_rules.explanation: Unspecified substance use codes require explicit provider documentation and cannot be inferred (Evidence: pg no: 44, L55-L56)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Must meet definition of reportable diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 44, L56)
detailed_rules.explanation: These codes must satisfy the criteria for reportable diagnoses as defined in Section III (Evidence: pg no: 44, L56)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use only when associated with substance-related disorder or medical condition (Evidence: pg no: 44, L57-L59)
detailed_rules.explanation: Unspecified substance use codes require association with chapter 5 disorders or medical conditions (Evidence: pg no: 44, L57-L59)
